channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: 3 Netflix Shows You Need to Binge This Weekend (September 19 - 21)
item.dc:creator: Joe Keeley
item.content:encoded: We're hurtling through the year and another weekend has arrived, which means it's time to settle down on the couch and binge some Netflix shows. Not sure what to watch? That's where I come in, since every week I have three top recommendations for your viewing pleasure.

item.title: Here’s What the iPhone 17, 17 Pro, and Air Colors Actually Look Like
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Seeing is believing, so we took some pictures.
item.content:encoded: It’s iPhone launch day, which means it’s finally time to see what the new models look and feel like outside of marketing materials. Can’t get down to your local Apple Store? Not to worry, I went down bright and early (Australia time) to grab a few photos and register some first impressions.

item.title: Quick Insert Is Your Chromebook's Hidden Superpower
item.dc:creator: Zach Gray-Traverso
item.description: The Quick Insert feature gives you a number of tools without ever leaving your page
item.content:encoded: Composing an email or writing an article can require a lot of resources. You may have to switch between multiple tabs, reference multiple files, or use multiple apps to compile all of your information. Fortunately, Chromebooks include a little known feature called Quick Insert.

item.title: Jackery’s New 3600 Plus Is a Power Station for Your House
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: It can run a fridge for nearly 14 days.
item.content:encoded: The smart energy company and popular power station brand Jackery just launched one of its biggest devices, the HomePower 3600 Plus. It hopes you'll use it to keep the lights on during an emergency power outage and touts it as a capable whole-home backup solution.

item.title: 5 PC Building Mistakes I Made That You Don’t Have To
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Don't make the same mistakes I did.
item.content:encoded: Building a custom PC is fun. But, there are definitely some pitfalls that you could encounter when assembling your first PC. Having built numerous systems over the past decade, I’ve learned a lot of the mistakes that can be made, and now I want to tell you about them so you don’t make the same ones I did.

item.title: KDE Plasma 6.5 Beta Is Here, and I'm Excited
item.dc:creator: Jordan Gloor
item.description: Themes, search, and clipboard manager are all getting big improvements.
item.content:encoded: The KDE Plasma version 6.5 just got released in beta, and it's bringing some exciting upgrades to the popular open source desktop environment for Linux and BSD operating systems. Dark mode switching, KRunner, and the clipboard manager are among the features seeing improvements.

item.title: I Tried Typing on Two Keyboards at Once for a Week, Here’s How It Went
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.description: Double the keyboards, double the speed... right?
item.content:encoded: Many of us mechanical keyboard enthusiasts have more than one keyboard—collecting comes with the hobby. As I was staring at my two mechanical keyboards the other day, an idea popped into my head: what would happen if I used both of them simultaneously?

item.title: Don’t Buy an Expensive AMD Motherboard, Buy One of These Instead
item.dc:creator: Goran Damnjanovic
item.description: Save some cash on the motherboard and put it toward a faster GPU or CPU.
item.content:encoded: AMD motherboards based on the AM5 socket are quite pricey on average. There are numerous models priced above $300, with many costing more than $400. On one hand, that’s somewhat understandable considering the features (PCIe 5.0, USB4, Wi-Fi 7), but on the other, AM5 boards sure are expensive.

item.title: Your Samsung Fridge ls Also Getting Ads Soon
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.description: Everyone was asking for this, or something.
item.content:encoded: You have ads on your phone, your TV, your computer, and pretty much every electronic in your house. Now, Samsung wants to make your kitchen into free ad real estate, too.

item.title: Anker’s Recalled Batteries Caused Fires and 'Substantial Property Damage'
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Check the list and replace any recalled models.
item.content:encoded: With how popular portable battery packs are, when a bunch of packs suddenly start catching fire, it's a pretty big deal. In June, Anker announced a recall on over a million battery packs, then added five more models to the list a few weeks later "out of an abundance of caution." After further investigation, some of these certainly carry a risk, so this is your reminder to dispose of and replace any affected units.
